result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Cory Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The cash bond posted with the Clerk of Court Office on behalf of the Defendant applied towards the financial obligations. (Rec...#14R 09460)

Def shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEF IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  The Def shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..  Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.  Def is to obtain a mental health assessment & to follow thru with all recommendations.  Def shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Def to have NO abusive contact w/Raquel Torgerson.  Def to have NO contact w/Ashland Walmart & Michael Neibauer. The Def is to provide a DNA specimen.
The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties. "A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving, obtaining a firearm/body armor."  NOTE: Under WI stat 6.03(1)(b) a person found G of felony is ineligible to vote in any civil election until your civil rights are restored!
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.
